author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name is not at least five characters long

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

It seems I am 1 character off in the name for auto merging.

However I can't see many other names for the "Beta Machine Learning Toolkit"... `BetaMLT` ? I believe `Bmlt` is quite a unique combination of letters. Also I have submodules, so the user have already to type `using Bmlt.Nn` or `using Bmlt.Perceptron`...

How about `BetaML`?
I think the Toolkit is implied, given that it is indeed a package.
I think library, package, and toolkit are synonymous

@oxinabox  I agree with you and I am eventually ok for that name, still I would have preference for the original `Bmlt` name if possible. The reasons is that (1) I will refer to the package always as a "toolkit", so I believe "t" is somehow expected in the name (a bit like "SciKit"), and (2) I may want in the future to change the meaning of the leading "B" from "Beta" (the name of my university lab) to a more universal  (and perhaps more appropriate) "Basic" meaning...

So, if possible I would stay with the original name `Bmlt`, otherwise no pbm, I'll use the suggested "BetaML", thank you.

@oxinabox could you please give your ok with the name (even if you would prefer BetaML) or should I rather change it ?
Thank you..

I am not in  position to make requirements of you.
I personally think `Bmlt` is a almost incomprehensible set of random letters.
At no opoint looking at it will I know what it means.
Only other things I can think of that exist in the wild like that at NLTK, HTK, HFST.
All of which i also don't like.

**But I am neither the author of the package, nor the maintainer of the registry.**
So I am in no position to do anything more than give suggestions.
Its not my game.

You need to talk to @StefanKarpinski , @DilumAluthge  or one of the other maintainers of the registry

It's ultimately your call, but I agree that this is not a great name and it's very much not in the naming style of the ecosystem. Whether we want them to or not, names matter; if you want this to have a chance at success, I would suggest a name that is more harmonious with the Julian style. BetaML, as Lyndon suggested, seems like a good name, for example. If you're going to stick with Bmlt then you should at least capitalize all the letters to conform to the Julia convention of capitalizing acronyms, so the package would be `BMLT` instead.
ok, gonna change the name, thank you everyone...
Please close this pull request --> pull request under the new name: https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/16047
